greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of numerators of harmonic mean of n and m, 1 <= m <= n.
comment: The harmonic mean H(n,m) is the reciprocal of the arithmetic mean of the reciprocals of n and m: H(n,m) = 1/((1/2)*(1/n +1/m)) = 2*n*m/(n+m). 1/H(n,m) marks the middle of the interval [1/n, 1/m] if m < n: 1/H(n,m) = 1/n + (1/2)*(1/m - 1/n). For m < n one has m < H(n,m) < n, and H(n,n) = n.
For the rationals H(n,m)/2 see A221918(n,m)/A221919(n,m). See the comments under A221918.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Harmonic Mean .
